title: 107_hr2310
content:
The "Military Pay Raise Act of 2001" increases monthly basic pay for uniformed services members effective January 1, 2002, based on pay grade and years of service. The "Military Pay Raise Act of 2001" increases monthly basic pay for commissioned officers based on pay grade and years of service. The "Military Pay Raise Act of 2001" increases monthly basic pay for commissioned officers based on pay grade and years of service. The pay percentages for different officer ranks are as follows:
- O-4: 9.0%
- O-3: 8.3%
- O-2: 7.3%
- O-1: 7.3%
- O-10 to O-5: 7.3% The Military Pay Raise Act of 2001 increases monthly basic pay for commissioned officers based on pay grade and years of service. The pay percentages for different officer ranks are as follows:
- O-4: 9.0%
- O-3: 8.3%
- O-2: 7.3%
- O-1: 7.3%
- O-10 to O-5: 7.3%
- O-10 to O-1: 7.3% for officers over 18 to over 26 years old. The Military Pay Raise Act of 2001 increases monthly basic pay for commissioned officers based on pay grade and years of service. The pay percentages for different officer ranks are as follows:
- O-4: 9.0%
- O-3: 8.3%
- O-2: 7.3%
- O-1: 7.3%
- O-10 to O-5: 7.3%
- O-10 to O-1: 7.3% for officers over 18 to over 26 years old. Commissioned officers with over 4 years of active duty service have pay percentages ranging from 7.3% to 8.3% based on their pay grade. Commissioned officers with over 4 years of active duty service have pay percentages ranging from 7.3% to 8.3% based on their pay grade, with increments for different age brackets. Warrant officers' pay percentages are based on years of service, with increments for different pay grades and years served. Warrant officers' pay percentages increase based on years of service, with increments for different pay grades and years served. The pay percentages range from 7.5% to 8.5% for various service years. Warrant officers' pay percentages increase based on years of service, ranging from 7.5% to 8.5% for different service years across pay grades W-1 to W-4. Enlisted members' pay percentages vary based on pay grade and years of service, ranging from 7.3% to 10.5% for different service lengths. Enlisted members' pay percentages vary based on pay grade and years of service, ranging from 7.3% to 10.5% for different service lengths. The pay percentages for each pay grade increase incrementally with years of service. Enlisted members' pay percentages range from 7.3% to 10.5% based on pay grade and years of service, increasing incrementally with service length. Enlisted members' pay percentages range from 7.3% to 8.5% based on pay grade, with incremental increases for years of service. The adjustment to monthly basic pay rates for uniformed services members in fiscal year 2002 required by section 1009 of title 37, United States Code, will not be made.
